intro: Ajuga brachystemon, commonly known as carpet bugle or small-leaf bugle, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular blue to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and blooms. Ajuga brachystemon is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in woodland areas.
